resources.string: Are you sure you want to remove the disk \"%1$s\"?\nAll it\'s content will be deleted permanently!

based on Mini vMac 37.03 by Paul C. Pratt

Mini vMac need access to your external storage in order to read the ROM file and to read and write to the disk images.
Sorry, but Mini vMac must have external storage permissions to start.

Cannot read data directory: %1$s

This directory should contain a ROM file named "%2$s" and the disk images.

Please refer https://www.gryphel.com/c/minivmac/start.html for more info.
Error loading ROM file.\n\n Please choose a new file from the settings menu.
Sorry, I couldn\'t create the disk because an I/O error occurred. Make sure you got enough space on your SD card.
File already exists. Please choose a different disk name.
I can not mount that many Disk Images. Try ejecting one.
Fit target screen to host screen
Use the arrow keys to scroll the screen
Unable to load this ROM file. Please choose a valid ROM file.
Your device does not support file browsing.

For this emulator to work, a valid %s ROM file must be provided. Please click the "Browse…" button to select the file from your device.

Please refer https://www.gryphel.com/c/minivmac/start.html for more info.
If you are migrating from an older version of %s:

Due to the new Android permissions model, the app will no longer be able to read the ROM file and disks images from your external SD card. You will have to manually select your ROM file using the \"Browse…\" button below and then manually import all your disks from the \"Manage Disks\" screen.\nThe ROM file and disk images will be copied to the local app storage on your device.
